story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: prestige_override
primary_trope.hook_text: Dirty Reiver's tier was OVERRIDDEN. Here's why.
primary_trope.mechanism: Zeigarnik effect — the unresolved question (is the override fair?) demands closure.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Dirty Reiver? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Dirty Reiver scored 77 out of 100. The Icons tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Dirty Reiver. Kielder, Northumberland, England. 130 mi. Classic British suffering. Cold, wet, hilly, and beautiful. Kielder Forest doesn't negotiate.
beats.text_on_screen: Dirty Reiver | Kielder, Northumberland, England | 130 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: The numbers. All fourteen of them. Prestige. 5 out of 5. Bucket list tier. The name speaks for itself. Experience. 5 out of 5. Transformative. People come back different. Epic forest riding through one of Britain's most remote areas delivers memorable suffering. Length. 4 out of 5. Bring real food. Not just gels. 130 miles with 14,100 feet of climbing puts you in serious hurt-locker territory. Technicality. 4 out of 5. Bike handling matters here. Practice your descents. Rob Weaver describes Kielder's surfaces as "fist or larger size rocks embedded in them. Elevation. 4 out of 5. Mountain passes on the menu. Over 14,000 feet of climbing across 130 miles means relentless grinding. Climate. 4 out of 5. Weather is part of the race strategy. April in Northumberland delivers unpredictable conditions. Adventure. 4 out of 5. Serious exploration vibes. Far from pavement. Nearly 100% off-road through Britain's largest forest creates isolation and self-reliance demands. Race Quality. 4 out of 5. Premium race experience. Well-organized with proper feed stations, GPS tracking, and mandatory kit requirements.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest. Quick-fire. Community. 4 out of 5. Strong community. This race builds friendships. Field Depth. 4 out of 5. Competition is fierce. Train accordingly. Value. 4 out of 5. One of the better deals in gravel. Expenses. 4 out of 5. Reasonable costs. Plan a modest budget. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Competent operation. Shows up on time. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Oxygen plentiful. Power output normal.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

strengths: The challenge: Legitimate suffering. Not manufactured difficulty—earned.
The community: UK gravel riders are dedicated. Atmosphere is authentic.
The terrain: Kielder Forest is beautiful, remote, properly demanding.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

weaknesses: The sellout: 6 hours to register requires calendar blocking and fast fingers
The weather: British April can deliver misery. Pack for worst.
The terrain: If you've only done smooth gravel, technical sections will surprise you.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: The logistics. What you actually need to know.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: Newcastle - 90 minutes to Kielder
Lodging: Book immediately upon registration. Kielder is limited. Consider Hexham or Newcastle.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: ESSENTIAL UK EVENT. Yes, if British gravel interests you. Dirty Reiver is non-negotiable for UK gravel credibility. Just be ready for the registration sprint, the weather roulette, and the technical terrain that separates prepared riders from hopeful ones.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Dirty Reiver isn't quite right for you. If you want European gravel without UK weather: Traka 360. If you want bucket-list adventure: The Rift. If you want guaranteed conditions: Unbound.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Dirty Reiver? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, confused face, question marks floating, 'Dirty Reiver' bold text, tier badge 'THE ICONS', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
